definition: a park or stadium in which ball games (such as baseball) are played
a range (as of prices or views) within which comparison or compromise is possible

examples: my first guess wasn't even in the ballpark

definition: to estimate (something) roughly or casually : to give a ballpark estimate of (something, such as a number or price)
examples: The track doesn't release attendance numbers, but media members ballparked it at 42,500 in the facility, which seats more than 50,000.
When I work with clients I remind them that we are just ballparking the numbers.
He looked at the ceiling. He looked at the walls. He turned this way and that, craning his neck, like a contractor about to ballpark an estimate.
